pr_title: Add secrets support elastic agent configurations

timeline.bodyText: Will there be case wherein we want to add secure fields and not resolve them?
timeline.author: maheshp

replies.bodyText:
Yes. When we are calling the plugins which does not support secrets as of yet.
E.g. authorization, artifact.
replies.author: kritika-singh3

timeline.bodyText:
If secrets resolution for one of the cluster profile fails, the plugin would not get a ping for any of the clusters.
How do we notify users in cases of secret resolution failures?
timeline.author: maheshp

replies.bodyText:
If secret resolution fails for any cluster profiles, the server ping call will not go for the remaining of the clusters. Also, we will not be able to notify the users about the agents for which the plugin has been deleted.
While the error gets logged in server logs, do you think we should catch them nd display a server health message?
replies.author: kritika-singh3

timeline.bodyText:
In what cases would the clusterProfile be null, I am guessing for the Azure plugin. Can you please check?
Returning false in these conditions might break things?
timeline.author: maheshp

replies.bodyText:
Yes, in case the GoCD server was upgraded and their were few scheduled jobs which now won't have a cluster profile.
No it would not. The check was preset earlier as well. Also, we do a job reload based on timer, which checks for the above scenario and cancels the job with a message. Hence, sending false won't break things.
replies.author: kritika-singh3

timeline.bodyText: What happens when secret resolution fails and what should we do on failure?
timeline.author: maheshp

replies.bodyText:
The shouldAssignWork is called when a elastic agent registers with GoCD. In case, secret resolution fails, the agent will not be assigned any job nd will remain idle.
We can catch them nd ignore it.
replies.author: kritika-singh3

timeline.bodyText:
How do we handle secret resolution failures?
We are removing the job from jobCreationTimeMap before secrets are resolved. Will there be any repercussions of secret resolution failures after removing it from the map.
timeline.author: maheshp

replies.bodyText: This is called when a job gets completed. Secret resolution failure would mean that the plugin is not notified nd hence will not be able to delete the job. Also, the job plan related information in DB is also not deleted.
replies.author: kritika-singh3

timeline.message:
Resolving secrets for `clusterProfileChanges`
 - secrets will be resolved for both original/older cluster profile and the updated/newer one

Changes:
 - for createAgents and shouldAssign call: on secret failure - cancel the job. This is similar to wht we do for secret failure in pipelines
 - for job completed call - catch the rules related exception - add a server health message with a 5 minute timeout and log it
 - for heartbeat - catch the rules exception - add a server health message. This will get cleared up on a heartbeat call with the secrets fixed
 - for status reports - updated the controller to return 422 with the exception message

timeline.bodyText: As discussed we need to add a server health message if secret resolution fails and log it as well.
timeline.author: maheshp

timeline.bodyText: Resolving secrets for updated cluster profile: {}
timeline.author: maheshp

timeline.bodyText:
Guess we need to fail the job, not cancel. We fail in case of BuildAssignmentService as well.
The message needs to be update appropriately.
You will also need to add a message on the JobStatusTopic so that the JobStatusListener is called.
Also, I think the resolveSecrets methods should only resolve the secrets and not handle the errors. Let the callers handle exception and take necessary actions.
timeline.author: maheshp

replies.bodyText:
You will also need to add a message on the JobStatusTopic so that the JobStatusListener is called.

This is taken care by the schedule service class. Done.
replies.author: kritika-singh3

timeline.bodyText: It seems wrong for the shouldAssignWork method cancelling the job here. I think the caller of this method should handle the secret resolution exceptions and take necessary actions.
timeline.author: maheshp

replies.bodyText: I don't get it. If the service can cancel the job in the createAgent call, why can't it do so in shouldAssignWork?
replies.author: kritika-singh3

replies.bodyText: Hmmm, I think in both the cases I would have preferred the ElasticAgentPluginService not cancelling the job, the way create createAgent is implemented it makes it tough to make those changes.
replies.author: maheshp

timeline.bodyText: This should not be 422, it's not a user error.
timeline.author: maheshp

replies.bodyText:
The exception can be raised due to a secret being configured for a non-existent secret config id. Which is a user error.
If not 422, then what? 500?
replies.author: kritika-singh3

replies.bodyText:
The exception can be raised due to a secret being configured for a non-existent secret config id. Which is a user error.

These would be user errors during config update right.
replies.author: maheshp

replies.bodyText: Yes but these are not caught during full config save.
replies.author: kritika-singh3
